image.alt: Smiling patients and team members at Caples & Robinson Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Welcome to Caples & Robinson Orthodontics — Northeast Louisiana Board‑Certified orthodontists. Our team provides children, teen and adult orthodontics using advanced technology (soft‑tissue laser, digital x‑rays, intra‑oral scanner), personalized care, flexible payment options, and decades of combined experience.
We welcome new patients and offer complimentary consultations. Our goal is comfortable, high‑quality care delivered with friendly, down‑to‑earth service so every visit feels easy and productive.

items.title: Advanced Technology
items.text: We use modern tools like soft‑tissue lasers, digital X‑rays, and an intra‑oral scanner to improve comfort and precision.

items.title: Education & Experience
items.text: Our doctors bring decades of combined training and board‑certified expertise to every treatment plan.

items.title: Flexible Payments
items.text: We offer Orthobanc financing and in‑house plans so treatment fits your budget.

items.title: Outstanding Service
items.text: Friendly staff, patient‑focused visits, and same‑day care when possible make appointments simple and pleasant.

paragraphs.text: Dr. Chris Robinson is a board‑certified orthodontist and one of the lead doctors at Caples & Robinson Orthodontics. He is experienced in comprehensive orthodontic care, including treatment for cleft lip and palate as a member of the Cleft Palate Team of Northeast Louisiana.

image.alt: Dr. Chris Robinson, orthodontist at Caples & Robinson Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Dr. Ricky Caples is a board‑certified orthodontist and co‑leader of the practice. He and Dr. Robinson are known for providing skilled, patient‑centered orthodontic care across Northeast Louisiana and for their involvement with cleft palate treatment in the region.
We offer clear aligners, traditional braces, and retention options for children, teens and adults. Our doctors will recommend the treatment that best fits your needs.

testimonials.author: (anonymous in file)
testimonials.testimonial: “I am VERY impressed with Caples & Robinson. It is a fairly long drive for me to Monroe but is most certainly worth it!”

testimonials.author: (anonymous in file)
testimonials.testimonial: “One end of my permanent retainer broke off. The ladies had me in the office within a few hours, fixed it and had me back on my way. GREAT staff and care even 10 years after leaving the office.”

testimonials.author: Carol H.
testimonials.testimonial: “WOW!!! The staff is unbelievably patient, sweet, caring, and informative. The doctors are more than wonderful!!! This clinic goes above and beyond!!!”

og_meta.title: Home - Caples & Robinson Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Board‑certified orthodontists serving Northeast Louisiana with clear aligners, braces, and family‑focused care. Complimentary consultations available.

image.alt: Team of orthodontic professionals smiling in the Lakeshore Orthodontics office lobby

paragraphs.text: If you are going to straighten your teeth, you need to see an orthodontist. When you choose Caples & Robinson, you are receiving treatment by an exceptional, board‑certified team of professionals.

Your orthodontic care experience is fully personalized at Caples & Robinson. Our friendly, knowledgeable team will address every question and concern. Your oral health needs, goals, and priorities are the focus of your customized treatment plan. We want to work with you to create the beautiful, healthy smile of your dreams.

We use advanced technology including a soft tissue laser, digital x‑rays, and an intra‑oral scanner to plan efficient, comfortable treatment. We offer in‑house financing and flexible payment options to make care affordable.

New patients receive a complimentary orthodontic consultation; same‑day appointments are available when possible. Our team treats children, teens, and adults across multiple Northeast Louisiana locations, helping patients leave with healthier, more confident smiles.

paragraphs.text: We’re active in the local community, supporting schools and outreach programs and offering patient rewards that give back. Recently the practice was recognized with Top Docs 2024, Best of Lincoln Parish 2024, and Bayou Buzz 2024.

Get Started.title: What to expect at your first visit

paragraphs.text: Your initial consultation is a relaxed, thorough visit. You will meet our team, receive a complete oral exam with any needed X-rays, and we will review your medical history so we can plan safe, effective care.
We will discuss treatment options, estimated time and cost, and answer your questions. New patients are eligible for a free orthodontic consultation to help you decide the best path forward.

image.alt: Orthodontic consultation in a modern clinic

paragraphs.text: We accept most major insurance plans and will file claims electronically when possible to simplify your experience.

Flexible payment plans are available and our treatment coordinator will help you find an option that fits your budget. To schedule your free consultation call (318) 325-9655 or visit https://caplesrobinsonortho.com/contact-us/.
Before your appointment, please complete any health history or new patient information so we can provide safe, personalized care from day one.

image.alt: Awards and trust badges for Caples & Robinson Orthodontics

og_meta.title: Get Started | Caples & Robinson Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Begin your orthodontic journey with a free consultation at Caples & Robinson Orthodontics. Access patient forms and schedule online or call (318) 325-9655.

image.alt: Orthodontist consulting with a patient in Monroe, LA

paragraphs.text: Wires and brackets, commonly called braces, apply constant, gentle pressure to move teeth into better alignment. Braces are a reliable option for a wide range of bite and alignment issues and are often recommended when fixed appliances are required to achieve predictable results.

Damon braces are a self-ligating system designed to reduce friction and improve comfort for some patients. They may help shorten certain treatment phases and can be an option when patients want an efficient fixed-appliance approach.

image.alt: Close-up of orthodontic brackets on teeth

paragraphs.text: Ceramic braces blend with your tooth color and offer a less noticeable fixed-bracket option. They deliver similar tooth‑movement control to metal braces but may require extra care to avoid staining and preserve their appearance.

image.alt: Teen smiling while wearing ceramic braces

paragraphs.text: Lingual braces are placed on the tongue side of the teeth, making them invisible from the outside. They can be an excellent choice for patients who want hidden fixed appliances, though they may take longer to adapt to and can be more challenging to clean.

image.alt: Orthodontic treatment in progress inside the mouth

paragraphs.text: Clear aligner therapy uses a series of transparent, removable trays worn about 22 hours per day to move teeth gradually. Each tray is typically worn for a planned interval, and many adult patients complete treatment in roughly a year, though timing depends on the complexity of the case.

Aligners let you remove appliances to eat, brush, and floss, but they require high compliance and are not appropriate for every type of malocclusion. A consultation will determine whether aligners are a suitable option for you.

We offer brand-specific clear aligner solutions such as the Spark Aligner System, providing patients with removable, nearly invisible therapy tailored through advanced digital planning. Your orthodontist will review whether Spark or another system best matches your clinical needs.

image.alt: Clear aligner trays resting on a counter

paragraphs.text: Retention is a critical final phase after braces or aligner treatment. We provide custom removable retainers, traditional acrylic-and-wire retainers, and bonded (permanent) retainers to protect your results and maintain long-term stability.

Follow-up care and proper retainer wear are essential. Keep removable appliances in their case, clean them gently each day, and contact us if a retainer is lost or damaged so we can replace it promptly.

Facial and jaw pain can stem from many causes. We perform a thorough evaluation to determine the source and recommend targeted care such as appliances for grinding, guided exercises, or referral when surgical or specialty treatment is needed.
If you are experiencing jaw locking, popping, restricted movement, or persistent pain, schedule an examination so we can identify the right steps to relieve symptoms and protect your oral health.

image.alt: Illustration representing TMJ and jaw pain

paragraphs.text: Find answers to common questions about treatment options, scheduling, and payment plans at Caples Robinson Orthodontics.

accordion.header: What orthodontic treatments do you offer?

paragraphs.text: We provide traditional metal and ceramic braces for children and adults, Invisalign<sup>®</sup> clear aligners for a more discreet option, and custom retainers to maintain your new smile.

accordion.header: At what age should my child see an orthodontist?

paragraphs.text: The American Association of Orthodontists recommends an initial evaluation by age 7. Early visits let us monitor growth and, if needed, plan timely treatment for the best long-term results.

accordion.header: How long does treatment usually take?

paragraphs.text: Treatment length varies with the complexity of each case, but many patients finish care in about 12 to 24 months. We’ll give you a personalized timeline after your initial exam.

accordion.header: What payment and insurance options are available?

paragraphs.text: We offer flexible monthly payment plans and work with most major dental insurance carriers. Our financial coordinators will review your coverage and help you choose the best option.

accordion.header: How can I schedule an appointment?

paragraphs.text: Call or text us at (318) 325-9655, or request an appointment online at https://caplesrobinsonortho.com/contact-us/. We’ll find a convenient day and time for your visit.
